name: Sufficiently Advanced Tech
description: ...is indistinguishable from magic, or as the saying goes. This chapter will walk you through the customizations that have been made to Thaumcraft and provide a basic run-down of Ars magica.

quests.name: Entrance to the Arcane
quests.description: Thaumcraft: Where even the most logical man becomes a gibbering mess, and loves every second of it.  Therefore, even though the Thaunomicon itself is usually great at providing clues, We'll list the salient turning points here anyway.
prerequisites: {It Really is a Whole New Game}[Mind the Splinters]
{It Really is a Whole New Game}[Habilus]

tasks.longDescription: We have made the Thaumonomicon craftable. It is your in-game Guide Book to Thaumcraft. Some things may not be accurate, as /Gregorious hexii/ Artorus changes several recipes; including putting the book before the first wand by making it craftable, and making said wand Copper Capped.
Now that you have scribbled down the basic theory of thaumic resonance, craft a Copper Capped Wooden Wand, the simplest and crudest functional form of vis manipulation.

quests.name: Crafting Like a Magician
quests.description: The Arcane Worktable is one of the ways Thaumcraft adds for crafting things. Some things require vis in your wand, which you get by holding right click on a Node. See your Basic Information tab of the Thaumonomicon for details.

tasks.longDescription: Right Click a Thaumcraft Table with a Wand to get the Arcane Worktable. Pick it up for this quest.

quests.name: Thinking About Thaumaturgy
quests.description:
The Research Table is how you learn how to make most Thaumcraft blocks and items. You have to unlock Research Notes in the Thaumonomicon using aspect points you get by scanning blocks, items, and especially Nodes using the Thaumometer. You have to scan things in a certain order; thankfully you can also scan things in your inventory. 

 A good wizard tracks where all the nodes they have scanned were, and in what state they were last seen, no paper required.
prerequisites: {It Really is a Whole New Game}[Gleaning and Foraging]

tasks.longDescription: To make the Research table, place to Tables next to each other and right-click with Scribing Tools. These will be used up as you do the research minigame (see the Thaumonomicon for some details), and refill it with any Black Dye to continue using them.

quests.name: Toil and Trouble
quests.description: Alchemy Thaumcraft style starts out messy, belching toxic waste Flux all over. It has vitally important utility however, and can easily be upgraded to a clean machine that runs on fluid Essentia.

tasks.longDescription: The basic crucible is made by waving your wand over a common cauldron, like one you may be doing the washing in. Pick up the result for this quest. The Crucible will function only while the water within is bubbling, this requires either Nitor, Fire, or Lava beneath it.

quests.name: Essential Vapours
quests.description: Being quickly struck by the wastefulness of open-crucible alchemy, you must seek better ways... Perhaps examining the properties of Nitor and Alumentum will grant a clue... Ah-ha! A controlled furnace environment can be augmented with alembics (up to four) in order to distill the very essentia from items fed in, at the low price of solid furnace fuel. Now, how to prevent degradation... Of course! Jars. But jars formed and completely sealed by a touch of aqua vis.
prerequisites: {It Really is a Whole New Game}[Ferrous Metal Domination]

tasks.longDescription: The caustic properties of this gasseous essentia are far greater than any acid you have encountered in the workshop; specially built pipes will have to be constructed. Common cold iron seems oddly able to muffle the stranger outbursts, and quicksilver is the substance most resistant to contact corrosion; keeping the quicksilver spread over the entire inner surface takes a dash of magic. As a side-effect, any wand acts like the wrench for these tubes.

quests.name: Automated Alchemy
quests.description: There it is! An alchemical construct can be fed essentia in controlled quantities, but it must be pure distilled essentia. Now the water is not used, nor is any flux ever produced.

quests.name: A Real Wand
quests.description: Now that you have magic, it's past time to get a better wand to channel that magic with... Upon long reflection, the grand Greatwood trees seem to provide a fine wood to work magic with, and the thaumaturgic power of silver has been enshrined in myth and legend.

tasks.longDescription: Alas, silver is too easily tarnished and retains the imprint of it\0027s construction, muddying it's ability to channel and shape arbitrary vis. Perhaps a dip in the essence of pure magic will help.

quests.name: Altar or Henge?
quests.description: Now for the most visually appealing extremely dangerous crafting mechanic in this pack, the Infusion Altar from Thaumcraft. (In this world,) You will first have to understand alchemical manufacturing processes well enough to crystallize Purified Vinteum, as no other focus will do at the heart of this nexus.

tasks.longDescription: See Infusion in the Artifice tab in your Thaumonomicon for more information on the Infusion Altar.

quests.name: Sceptre of Crafting
quests.description: A stable wand will only go so far, to perform truly astounding feats of magic you should use the correct tool for the task. And for the task of crafting even better magical gear, the Sceptre is royal.

tasks.longDescription: The road to understanding a crafting sceptre is long in this pack. First one must consider how each of the six elements of vis respond. Then one may find materials capable of channeling each with equal ease.
It must be the basic artificing method that is flawed, neither of these materials have reached their proper potential. And yet, still more focus is required...
A masterful work of artistry, capable of fine definition and graceful art. Yet solidly inapplicable to blasting of any kind. Now it is obvious why the blasting staves were easier to understand.

quests.name: Rouse Not a Wizard's Ire
quests.description:
For they are terrible in wrath, holding many devious and delectable ways to inflict their will upon the world. 

Alas, while they can bash heads in a pinch, staves are useless for the fine work of arcane crafting.

tasks.longDescription: Working from the principle of a lens, Foci can be used to transform the raw vis you have been gathering into a material effect.

The six elemental wand cores' ability to self-generate vis of their specific element works wonders for simple combat foci. They merely need to be upgraded with Primal Charms and paired wand caps to become turgid with arcane might.

quests.name: Crazy Going Am
quests.description: And already loving it. You do not work this material, just invite the VOID to manifest. For it works you...whom art simply providing a guiding will to direct it's choice of form.

tasks.longDescription: ...nor vegtable...

quests.name: ...orcloth Strapped Silv...
quests.description: The Ultimate. The Alpha. The best dang wand this modpack has to offer. 1000 Essentia Capacity, 70% vis cost, a name that is 52 characters long! What CAN'T this wand do?!

tasks.longDescription: To unlock Ichor research, you need to research nearly all of regular Thaumcraft, and ALL non-Ichor related Thaumic Tinkerer research.  This means Basic Information, Thaumaturgy, half of Alchemy, most of Artiface, and Golemancy too.

quests.name: Behold My Mighty POWER!
quests.description: Nothing shall stand before me! I am Death, Destroyer of Mobs!

tasks.longDescription:
Combining the basic foci from each of the four classical elements into a single unit sounded crazy not so long ago. But crazy lives downstairs, power has the penthouse.

 They have mentioned that you can make an ichorcloth strapped STAFF core, if you like. Ichorium adorning a Primal Staff Core sounds like a better idea though.

quests.name: Minimal Expenditure
quests.description: For all the hype about the awesome wand you've recently crafted, it just feels lame somehow not to make a sceptre out of the best materials ever imagined. Ooh... 55 charactes... 60% base vis costs... hehehe...

tasks.longDescription: Too bad it doesn't self-recharge, otherwise this would be perfect for handling all the arcane crafting still to be done.

rewardchoice.nbt: {nodetype:0, Aspects:[0:{amount:100, key:aer}, 1:{amount:100, key:aqua}, 2:{amount:100, key:ignis}, 3:{amount:100, key:ordo}, 4:{amount:100, key:perditio}, 5:{amount:100, key:terra}], nodeid: {0:-5:120:4}}

quests.name: Maximum Utility
quests.description:
Since the wand was such a resounding success, maybe ichor will be outstanding at other Thaumaturgic tasks? 

 Isn't it notable how each relates to a pure classical element?

tasks.longDescription: Much like Thaumium and Void Metal, Ichorium can be crafted into a set of superior tools and weapons.

Lo! Ichorcloth is also far superior to simply enchanted fabric. These robes rival thaumium plate for turning aside harm, while simultaneously surpassing void-aspected robes for channeling vis. Crafting these makes the ichor... sceptre sound like a good idea. Doesn't it strike a further idea how each relates to a pure classical element?

quests.name: New Depths
quests.description: Use the power of this new pick, seek below the uncrossable. Access the inaccessible. Take in hand what only industrial magnates had before theorized.

quests.name: Practicaly Divinity
quests.description: There are few limits left to be stretched, apply thine art to upgrading the ichorium tools and ichorcloth robes into their final form!

tasks.longDescription: Obviously this will be expensive, difficult, and more than a little dangerous. One may wish to bling out the altar for maximum effect, garishness can be borne temporarily.

rewardchoice.nbt: {nodetype:5, Aspects:[0:{amount:100, key:aer}, 1:{amount:100, key:aqua}, 2:{amount:100, key:ignis}, 3:{amount:100, key:ordo}, 4:{amount:100, key:perditio}, 5:{amount:100, key:terra}], nodeid: {0:5:120:-4}}

quests.name: It Found Me, Finding It
quests.description: The penUlitmate power of the Ur-vis is yours to contain!!

tasks.longDescription: The cult of crimson were small-minded, this is so obvious!
...how unnervingly solid...
For it enlightened the unseen... Now at lAst I undErstand the VAStness of my IgnorAnce!?!!?>&!
